title: IBM Cloud overview docs
introduction: The platform is built to support your needs whether it's working only in the public cloud or taking advantage of a multicloud deployment model. Leverage the docs, API & SDK reference, architecture references, and more to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: What's included in the platform?
section_recommended.description: The platform consists of a network of interrelated components that work together to provide a consistent and dependable cloud experience to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: Try out IBM Cloud, for free
section_recommended.description: Get up and running quickly by setting up an account and exploring free products with this short tutorial.

section_recommended.title: Service and infrastructure by location
section_recommended.description: Check out the regions and data centers that IBM Cloud products are available.

tiles.title: Onboarding software with usage-based pricing plans
tiles.description: In addition to free and bring your own license plans, you can now add usage-based pricing plans to software onboarded with the virtual server image delivery method, offering it as a paid integrated product in the IBM Cloud catalog. After adding a plan to your software in Partner Center, you can also manage it in your private catalog. This includes adding features, changing the planâ€™s state, deprecating it, or updating plan details.

tiles.title: Google login and registration
tiles.description: Google is now available for IBM Cloud login and IBM Cloud registration. As a non-federated user, you can use your existing Google credentials to securely log in to IBM Cloud or create a new IBM Cloud account.

tiles.title: Experimental: Stack deployable architectures by using the console
tiles.description: You can now use the console to stack deployable architectures together to create more complex end-to-end solutions for your organization.
